abstract: Worries on Wall Street that the toll of the recession and last fall’s financial crisis will spread to the earnings of industrial companies, retailers and others.
snippet: Worries on Wall Street that the toll of the recession and last fall’s financial crisis will spread to the earnings of industrial companies, retailers and others.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street’s nagging fears about the financial system resurfaced on Monday, pushing stocks sharply lower. Even as the banking giant Bank of America posted big profits, investors fretted about losses and other write-downs that could be lurking.

headline.main: A New Round of Worries Pushes Shares Lower
headline.print_headline: A New Round of Worries Pushes Shares Lower
